properties.address: Burton Latimer Community Managed Library, Kettering, Northamptonshire NN15 5RH
properties.description: Warm welcoming space with comfortable seating, hot drinks and free Wi-Fi. Access to foodbank supported by KCU, appointments with Citizens Advice and Social Inclusion available. Customers can also access support with Blue Badge and Bus Pass applications and take part in a variety of Childrens and Families activities. We have a Friendship Cafe on Tuesday mornings and a Wellbeing Cafe on a Thursday evening. We look forward to meeting you all.
properties.title: Burton Latimer Community Managed Library

properties.description: The cafe is open on Wednesday mornings from 10.30 to 12.30 offering hot and cold drinks and snacks. We offer beans on toast, soup and a roll, spaghetti on toast and fruit. Everyone is welcome to come along for a chat in a warm friendly environment.
properties.title: Encompass Community Cafe

properties.description: Rushden Town Council has launched the Friends Of Rushden Hall Community group to provide a comfortable space for the residents of the town to socialise. The free Group runs on Friday afternoons at Rushden Hall, providing a welcoming space for visitors to socialise whilst enjoying activities such as bingo, and table-top board games, along with complimentary tea, coffee and biscuits. The Rushden Yarn Bomber also gather regularly to discuss ongoing projects and any new members are always very welcome. The group meets at Rushden Hall will continue to be held on Friday afternoons from 2pm to 4pm until further notice. There is no requirement to meet any criteria and it is totally free for all residents of Rushden.
properties.title: Friends of Rushden Hall

properties.address: North Northamptonshire Council, Wellingborough, Northamptonshire NN9 5PU
properties.description: Library space offering warm drinks, soup, and biscuits
properties.title: Irthlingborough Library

properties.address: Dalton Community Hall, Upper Dean, PE28 0LT
properties.description: Accessible parking and entrance, free car parking, charging facilities, hot or cold drinks and snack, disabled toilets, guide dog friendly, baby changing facilities. For local villagers only. The café serves as an information hub for the community, sharing details about events and hosting activities like "Coffee with a Cop" and acting as a collection point for the local food bank.

hours._text: First and third Thursday of every month: 10.30am to 12.30pm
